DataElement.preferredName: Chest Computed Tomography Scan Length Measurement
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the measurement of the linear extent in space from one end to the other end of data or image obtained by gathering information with a sensing device for a chest computed tomography scan.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to the linear extent in space from one end to the other end of data or image obtained by gathering information with a sensing device for a chest computed tomography scan.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The part of the human body between the neck and the diaphragm or the corresponding part in other vertebrates.:Tomography using x-ray transmission and a computer algorithm to reconstruct the image.

Concepts.definition: The anterior side of the thorax from the neck to the abdomen. The shape of the chest is often regarded as potential insight into a disease process, as in the case of barrel chest and respiratory dysfunction.
A method of examining structures within the body by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis.

Property.preferredDefinition: Pictures of structures inside the body. Scans often used in diagnosing, staging, and monitoring disease include liver scans, bone scans, and computed tomography (CT) or computerized axial tomography (CAT) scans and magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) scans. In liver scanning and bone scanning, radioactive substances that are injected into the bloodstream collect in these organs. A scanner that detects the radiation is used to create pictures. In CT scanning, an x-ray machine linked to a computer is used to produce detailed pictures of organs inside the body. MRI scans use a large magnet connected to a computer to create pictures of areas inside the body.:Length; the linear extent in space from one end to the other.

Concepts.definition: The data or image obtained by gathering information with a sensing device.
The linear extent in space from one end of something to the other end, or the extent of something from beginning to end.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the measurement of the linear extent in space from one end to the other end of data or image obtained by gathering information with a sensing device.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Measurement; the size or magnitude of something.

Concepts.definition: Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: Move to caBIG context as teh preferred Rep class for Measurement

DataElement.origin: CALGB CRF:Cancer and Leukemia Group B Case Report Form
